data.title: SHARING FRUITS
data.statement:
There are [[n]] fruits lying in a row on a long table. Each of these fruits is either apple or an orange. There is at least one apple and at least one orange on the table.

You and your brother want to divide the fruits on the table: you will take a prefix of this row (several leftmost fruits), and your brother will take the rest. However, there are several restrictions:

Each one for you should have at least one fruit for sure.
The number of your apples should differ from the number of your brother's apples.
The number of your oranges should differ from the number of your brother's oranges.
data.constraints:
2 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 200
It is guaranteed that [[s]] contains at least one letter {{A}} and at least one letter {{O}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int 
read s:string(256)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: contains one integer [[n]] the number of fruits on the table. 
<<Line 2>>: contains a string [[s]] of length [[n]]  consisting of letters {{A}} and {{O}}. 
[[i]]-th symbol represents the type of the [[i]]-th food item on the table: {{A}} stands for apple, and {{O}} stands for an orange.
data.outputDescription: One integer — a number [[k]] such that all the restrictions described in the statement are satisfied for the leftmost valid division (smallest value of [[k]]) when there are multiple possible answers. If there are no possible answers, then output {{-1}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

There are n fruits lying in a row on a long table. Each of these fruits is either apple or an orange. There is at least one apple and at least one orange on the table.

You and your brother want to divide the fruits on the table: you will take a prefix of this row (several leftmost fruits), and your brother will take the rest. However, there are several restrictions:

Each one for you should have at least one fruit for sure.
The number of your apples should differ from the number of your brother's apples.
The number of your oranges should differ from the number of your brother's oranges.
Input
Line 1: contains one integer n the number of fruits on the table.
Line 2: contains a string s of length n consisting of letters A and O.
i-th symbol represents the type of the i-th food item on the table: A stands for apple, and O stands for an orange.
Output
One integer — a number k such that all the restrictions described in the statement are satisfied for the leftmost valid division (smallest value of k) when there are multiple possible answers. If there are no possible answers, then output -1.
Constraints
2 ≤ n ≤ 200
It is guaranteed that s contains at least one letter A and at least one letter O.
Example
Input
4
AAAO
Output
1
